title: UPDATE: Victims killed in shooting incident at Shawnee Park identified; 5 others hurt
content:
LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) - Police now say a total of seven people were shot at Shawnee Park Thursday afternoon.
Two of the victims were killed. The other five were taken to a hospital with non-life-threatening injuries. Two of them were transported by EMS; the other three were driven to the hospital by personal vehicles.
Authorities initially had said that six people were shot with only four people having suffered non-fatal injuries.
The deceased have been identified as Michael L. Carter, 26, and William D. McKee, 32, both of Louisville. Carter died of multiple gunshot wounds. McKee died of a single gunshot wound, according to the Jefferson County Coroner's Office.
Police have not made any arrests in the case.
RELATED STORIES
+ RAW VIDEO: Facebook Live records 19 gunshots during deadly incident at park
+ Several people shot during Thanksgiving Day football game
+ IMAGES: Mass shooting at Shawnee Park
Lt. Emily McKinley with the Louisville Metro Police Department Homicide Unit said a dispute occurred among a group of people socializing at the park just before 2 p.m. Thursday, weapons were pulled and shots were fired.
This story will be updated.
